snippet: Taoufik Makhloufi of Algeria was expelled, then later reinstated, after he stopped running in an 800-meter heat. He was accused of quitting to preserve his endurance for Tuesday’s 1,500-meter final.
abstract: Inside The Rings; Algerian runner Taoufik Makhloufi is expelled, then later reinstated, after he stopped running in an 800-meter heat to preserve his endurance for a 1,500-meter final; incident raises ethical questions about whether Olympic athletes must always give their best effort, even when it might work against their interests.
lead_paragraph: Taoufik Makhloufi of Algeria was expelled, then later reinstated, after he stopped running in an 800-meter heat. He was accused of quitting to preserve his endurance for Tuesday’s 1,500-meter final.

headline.seo: Algerian Runner Makhloufi Expelled Then Reinstated at Olympics
headline.main: After a Runner Stops, the Questioning Starts
headline.print_headline: After a Runner Stops, The Questioning Starts
